fragment.title: Fragment | Mateo Bonilla
fragment.description1: Fragment is a metroidvania inspired by the theme of schizophrenia. You progress to uncover the story while interacting with various characters who challenge your identity and reveal who you may truly be.

objective1.title: Proposal
objective1.item1: Raise awareness about a taboo illness.
objective1.item2: Develop a project that brings visibility to the condition.
objective1.item3: Promote understanding that in some cases, people can live a normal life.

objective2.title: Research
objective2.item1: Identify knowledge barriers about the illness.
objective2.item2: Understand the level of awareness in specific cases.
objective2.item3: Explore how much people know about mental health conditions.

objective3.title: Product
objective3.item1: Design a video game that raises awareness about mental health disorders.
objective3.item2: Create gameplay focused on the illness as the main character.
objective3.item3: Combine awareness, visibility, and entertainment in a single product.

fragment.keyFinding1: Lack of information about mental health disorders.
fragment.keyFinding2: Social stigma or rejection towards people with mental health issues.
fragment.keyFinding3: Limited understanding and empathy toward these conditions.
fragment.projectItem1: It has a 2D narrative focus, where the player takes the role of a protagonist with schizophrenia.
fragment.projectItem2: The main objective is to distinguish what is truly real.
fragment.storyItem1: The main theme is the internal acceptance of schizophrenia and the search for mental balance.
fragment.storyItem2: The world represents how the main character perceives reality.
fragment.designItem1: In the design phase, I translated the defined concepts into visual and functional solutions through wireframes and an interactive prototype.
fragment.sketchDescription: Level design sketch showing structure and possible interactive elements.
fragment.resultsDescription: A digital experience that allows anyone to become aware of these types of mental health conditions, learn, explore, and engage without intimidation. The game integrates mechanics, gradual education, and visibility to present these topics in an accessible, engaging, and entertaining way.
fragment.resultItem1: Complete demo of the first level of the game, including gameplay, interaction, and story.
fragment.resultItem2: Integrated narrative within secondary NPC characters.
fragment.resultItem3: Real mechanics inspired by actual mental health conditions.
fragment.challengesDescription: This project was both rewarding and challenging. Throughout the process, it was fulfilling to see how an initial idea gradually took shape and evolved with each iteration. Observing how research, design, and development came together to create a real solution helped me strengthen my skills, apply empathy and resilience, and trust in the creative process.
fragment.challengeItem1: Working with mental health topics, although complex, can lead to interesting design ideas.
fragment.challengeItem2: Implementing mental conditions into gameplay mechanics was challenging but very enjoyable.
fragment.challengeItem3: I learned how to translate concepts and designs into functional code.
fragment.nextStep1: Develop a full game exploring these topics in more depth.
fragment.nextStep2: Release the game on platforms such as Steam or Play Store.
fragment.nextStep3: Build a community to increase awareness and visibility of projects like this.

bg.title: Banco Guayaquil | Design Challenge
bg.description1: Design and prototyping of a credit card application workflow for Banco Guayaquil’s mobile app, focused on improving accessibility and reducing user friction. The flow supports both current app users and new customers.

objective1.title: Proposal
objective1.item1: Simplify the credit card application process.
objective1.item2: Enhance user accessibility within the banking ecosystem.
objective1.item3: Provide a seamless experience for both new and existing customers.

objective2.title: Research
objective2.item1: Analyze user pain points in traditional credit application flows.
objective2.item2: Identify UX gaps and opportunities for improvement.
objective2.item3: Collect qualitative insights from mobile banking users.

objective3.title: Product
objective3.item1: Design an intuitive, step-by-step digital flow for credit card requests.
objective3.item2: Integrate UI consistency with Banco Guayaquil’s branding.
objective3.item3: Develop a clickable prototype for usability testing.

bg.keyFinding1: Complex processes for applying for a credit card.
bg.keyFinding2: Lack of accessibility for users who are not Banco Guayaquil clients.
bg.keyFinding3: Process available only through the web.
bg.projectItem1: The main goal of the redesign is to create a new mobile app feature to simplify the credit card application process.
bg.projectItem2: The new functionality must be accessible to both Banco Guayaquil clients and non-clients.
bg.storyItem1: Ease of use, intuitiveness, and a friendly design.
bg.resultsDescription: The final prototype provides a faster, more intuitive application process. Through visual clarity, simplified inputs, and consistent feedback, the design improves usability and accessibility for all users.
bg.resultItem1: Enhanced task completion speed by 30% (based on test feedback).
bg.resultItem2: Improved perceived trust through visual hierarchy and spacing.
bg.resultItem3: Prototype validated with user tests and iteration cycles in Figma.
bg.challengesDescription: Creating a financial UX that feels human-centered was both challenging and rewarding. Balancing simplicity with trust and ensuring accessibility across all users required thoughtful iteration and feedback analysis.
bg.nextStep1: Conduct A/B testing with real users to optimize onboarding performance.
bg.nextStep2: Extend the design system to additional product flows (loans, accounts).
bg.nextStep3: Collaborate with developers for implementation in Banco Guayaquil’s mobile app.

dlc.title: DLC | Mateo Bonilla
dlc.description1: Dragon Learning Center es una aplicación móvil diseñada para los estudiantes de la USFQ, que permite agendar tutorías en materias específicas. Los usuarios pueden registrarse como tutores o estudiantes, revisar la disponibilidad y reservar citas fácilmente.
dlc.description2: Tecnologías utilizadas: Angular, Ionic Framework, TypeScript, SCSS, JavaScript, HTML5, Firebase (backend), Figma y Adobe Illustrator (diseño y prototipado).
dlc.resultsDescription: La aplicación optimizó el proceso de tutorías para los estudiantes de la USFQ, mejorando la accesibilidad, usabilidad e interacción entre tutores y alumnos. Su diseño intuitivo aumentó la participación y la colaboración académica.
dlc.result1: Los estudiantes pueden agendar y hacer seguimiento de sus sesiones desde el móvil.
dlc.result2: Los tutores gestionan su disponibilidad y materias en tiempo real.
dlc.result3: La aplicación fomenta el aprendizaje colaborativo mediante una interfaz fácil de usar.
dlc.challengesDescription: Desarrollar una aplicación móvil para uso académico supuso equilibrar usabilidad, escalabilidad y accesibilidad. Este proyecto fortaleció mis habilidades en diseño basado en componentes, interfaces responsivas e integración de retroalimentación de usuarios.
dlc.challenge1: Integración de autenticación y programación en tiempo real con Firebase.
dlc.challenge2: Diseñar para estudiantes y tutores con diferentes necesidades.
dlc.challenge3: Asegurar un rendimiento fluido en dispositivos Android e iOS.
dlc.next1: Implementar notificaciones y recordatorios de sesiones.
dlc.next2: Agregar analíticas para medir el progreso académico.
dlc.next3: Expandir la aplicación a una versión web para mayor accesibilidad.
dlc.objective1Item1: Allow students to easily schedule tutoring sessions through a user-friendly mobile interface.
dlc.objective1Item2: Ensure all users can access the app regardless of device or technical level.
dlc.objective2Item1: Simplify the process of connecting tutors and students.
dlc.objective2Item2: Automate scheduling and notifications for both roles.
dlc.objective3Item1: Promote academic collaboration and peer learning within the university.
dlc.objective3Item2: Create a trusted system where tutors gain visibility and credibility.
dlc.keyFinding1: Students faced difficulty finding available tutors quickly.
dlc.keyFinding2: Manual scheduling was time-consuming and often led to miscommunication.
dlc.keyFinding3: Users wanted a unified platform for tutoring management.
dlc.projectItem1: Define a simple and intuitive booking flow for both tutors and students.
dlc.projectItem2: Design clear navigation and visual hierarchy to support accessibility.
dlc.storyItem1: Connect learning and teaching in a single, easy-to-use app.
dlc.storyItem2: Design focused on clarity, minimal steps, and visual feedback.
dlc.designItem1: Wireframes and interactive prototypes were created in Figma to validate flows.
dlc.designItem2: User testing guided interface adjustments for usability and readability.
